channel.title: Hosting problems
channel.description:
I have send my server to my friend so my friend could host but when he click run to start the server than he gets
java.net.BindException: Address already in use: JVM_Bind at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(PlainSocketImpl.java:365) at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(ServerSocket.java:319) at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:185) at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:141) at palidino76.rs2.net.SocketListener.<init>(SocketListener.java:40) at palidino76.rs2.Server.main(Server.java:83)

item.title: Hosting problems
item.dc:creator: @yniace yniace
item.description:
@yniace wrote:

laurent 248:

Tell him to not open his port with Utorrent, search a tutorial. Because Utorrent only allow the port for Utorrent. And if u change the Utorrent port it will delete the port forward.

Can u add my friend on msn and help him please? Poepkip3@hotmail.com

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting problems
item.dc:creator: @laurent_248 laurent 248
item.description:
@laurent_248 wrote:

Tell him to not open his port with Utorrent, search a tutorial. Because Utorrent only allow the port for Utorrent. And if u change the Utorrent port it will delete the port forward.

item.title: Hosting problems
item.dc:creator: @yniace yniace
item.description:
@yniace wrote:

[quote=“laurent 248, post:2, topic:369536”][quote author=yniace link=topic=465664.msg3405131#msg3405131 date=1290269890]
I have send my server to my friend so my friend could host but when he click run to start the server than he gets

java.net.BindException: Address already in use: JVM_Bind
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method)
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(PlainSocketImpl.java:365)
at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(ServerSocket.java:319)
at java.net.ServerSocket.(ServerSocket.java:185)
at java.net.ServerSocket.(ServerSocket.java:141)
at palidino76.rs2.net.SocketListener.(SocketListener.java:40)
at palidino76.rs2.Server.main(Server.java:83)
[/quote]

It means He’s already hosting a server or using port 43594 or the port of the server. If he tryied utorrent to port forward, tell him to change the utorrent port.[/quote]

He changed the port but now if he opens client it wont load?

Read full topic
